DataElement.preferredName: Medical Device Central Venous Access Catheter Lumen Treatment Unit Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a numeric value unit related to a channel within a tubular organ surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Central Venous Access Catheter Medical Device   Lumen
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a channel within a tubular organ surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tube surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs. It also can be used to obtain blood samples. This device avoids the need for separate needle insertions for each infusion or blood test. Examples of these devices include Hickman catheters, which require clamps to make sure the valve is closed, and Groshong catheters, which have a valve that opens as fluid is withdrawn or infused and remains closed when not in use.:Medical device - any machinery designed to aid diagnostic and medical therapies. Medical device has to be designed with rigorous safety standards. There are several basic types of medical devices: life support equipment used to maintain a patient's body functions; therapeutic equipment; monitors and detectors to measure the indexes of a patient's state; imagine machines and laboratory equipment used with diagnostic and status monitoring purposes. In insurance parlance, the term is usually synonymous with assistive device, although it may include medical supplies.

Concepts.definition: A venous catheter positioned with the tip in the proximal third of the superior vena cava, the right atrium, or the inferior vena cava.
Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: The cavity or channel within a tube or tubular organ such as a blood vessel or the intestine.

Concepts.definition: The cavity or channel within a tube or tubular organ such as a blood vessel or the intestine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numeric value quantifying stored containers of fluid or blood product for infusion into an individual at time of need.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any division of quantity accepted as a standard of measurement or exchange.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else.
Determining the number or amount of something.
